data.title: Beautiful Monument
data.text: While we were walking downtown we passed by this Monument. It made us stop and take a picture because it is unique and beautiful.

data.title: Photo Opp
data.text: Another photo opp for our trip. Great addition to the public square. The entire square has been re-vamp. This winter their are going to have ice skating for the first time.

data.title: very moving
data.text: What a great tribute to both soldiers and sailors alike. Very large memorial with lots of details. Worth stopping to visit.

data.title: Educational gem downtown
data.text: Civil war monument has been beautifully restored. The volunteers are very knowledgeable and clearly very proud of the site.

data.title: Tour of the facility
data.text: It was very interesting. The staff was helpful in answering questions. The new Public Square is quite nice.

data.title: Neat looking statue outside Jack's Casino
data.text: If bored waiting for museums to open can walk around downtown outside Jack's Casino & see some neat statues like this one & giant bird on lawn statues. Best to use 1 of the individual day lots for $10 parking, Jack's Casino parking over $20. Nearby Tower Center mall does have a train station inside if commuting that way.

data.title: Unexpected but easy to miss
data.text: Although this is pretty huge its on a roundabout between the biggest buildings in the state so you almost take it for granted. If there wasn't traffic all about you might be able to enjoy it more, but they've made good use of the area with a fountain and a restaurant and the memorial itself is very imposing close up. Take a look, but no need to stay too long as an out of towner.

data.title: A tribute to past lives given during the Civil War.
data.text: Not only was this a very scenic monument from the out side, you can go inside to learn more. Once inside you will be greeted by a tour guide that will explain every thing you see and give definition to the past.

data.title: love the upgrade
data.text: My compliments to the updated Public Square.  It really is a very inviting space with the monument as it's central fixture the square is rejuvenated.  Very nicely done.

data.title: An unexpected surprise
data.text: The sculpture stands out from blocks away, but the surprise is to go inside and see the list on names dating to the civil war along with the former resting spot of Lincoln's casket while he laid in state.

data.title: Loved seeing the sights!
data.text: There is alot of history. I love the small-town feel in this big city!  Everything worth seeing is within walking distance!

data.title: A beautiful memorial in Public Square
data.text: This is one of my favorite places in Cleveland. It's a beautiful memorial erected after the Civil War. Not a lot of people know, but you can go inside and see the gorgeous engravings. It was recently renovated. A little trivia, the monument is seen in the opening scenes of A Christmas Story.

data.title: Beautiful historic site
data.text: Had a little time before heading to airport while traveling on business, and was glad to come across this beautiful historical monument.  Don't miss out on this gem if you are in the downtown area.  Very nice museum, free of cost.

data.title: Wonderful Monument
data.text: This is a true gem, found right in the heart of the city. We went inside and the information provided and displays were wonderful. Would thoroughly recommend a visit.

data.title: Sobering
data.text: A great reminder that we're still fighting the same battles.  Awe inspiring monument to freedom. A nice downtown walk.

data.title: great place in history dont miss
data.text: this is a nice stop on you tour of cleveland ohio. this wounderful museum and memorial to the fighting men of history. also a little scary especially in the basement where the caretaker is glad to tell of stories of ghostly visitors of the dead.lots of things from wars gone buy

data.title: The anchor to downtown Cleveland
data.text: It appears that the monument and the public square surrounding it have been recently upgraded.   Its nice to have a city that still respects its veterans.  The only drawback is that it is across the street from the casino and the park seems to be a magnet for bums and beggers.

data.title: Soldiers' and Sailors' Monument
data.text: Right on Public Square, this little gem is very interesting. There is volunteer person to guide you, point out interesting facts, talk a little about history, and wonderful panels of sculptured historical figures. Ask about the tunnels under Cleveland.

data.title: History buff
data.text: This was a nice experience as we were walking through downtown.  Free place to take some pictures in what felt like the center of Cleveland.  This would be even better for those history buffs as the details of Cleveland and the history were quite interesting.  Would recommend stopping in if you are in the area and not from the city.  I will also say the attendant inside was very helpful and provided great guidance on what we would see as we walked through.

data.title: Worth a Visit
data.text:
My friends and I stopped by the monument while waiting for our names to clear the Wait List for one of the restaurants on East 4th Street. Our thought was to check out the new renovations around Public Square. When we approached the Soldiers & Sailors Monument, we noticed a door was open, so we went inside. We had no idea that you could actually tour the inside of the monument! 

There is an information person inside who describes the history of the museum, and can explain all about the beautiful bronze statues placed around the room. He can also answer any questions you may have. We spent about 15-20 minutes inside looking at all of the names of the Civic War veterans, and looking with awe at the statues. This really is an amazing monument, and it's free! Definitely worth the time to stop and see it for yourself when you're in downtown Cleveland.
